channel.title: LINUX on Nathan Obert
channel.description: Recent content in LINUX on Nathan Obert

item.title: Changing the colors in BASH
item.description: Changing colors in BASH So I find some color combations very hard to read. If you have a black background, the dark blue directory color is hard to read. If you have a white background the bright green executable color is hard to read. For whatever reason it was not thought very well through to have well contrasting colors for everything. I found this Ask Ubunutu on how to change the directory colors and decided to write a blog post to make sure I never lost the steps again.

item.title: Map Windows share to Linux
item.description: Mounting Windows on Linux Setup on Ubuntu sudo apt-get install keyutils sudo apt-get install cifs-utils Setup on Redhat sudo yum install keyutils cifs-utils Syntax UNC=server.domain.com/share USERNAME=yourwindowslogin DOMAIN=NAMEOFDOMAIN PASSWORD=yourpassword sudo mkdir -p /mnt/${UNC} sudo mount -t cifs -o username=${USERNAME},domain=${DOMAIN},password=${PASSWORD} //${UNC} /mnt/${UNC}
